title: Sachin Tendulkar and Brian Lara to play in new T20 tournament
text:
Cricket legends Sachin Tendulkar and Brian Lara will play in the new T20 tournament (Picture: Getty)

Sachin Tendulkar and Brian Lara are among the legendary cricketers who will take part in the Road Safety World Series in India next year.

Retired players from five countries – India, Australia, West Indies, South Africa and Sri Lanka – will take place in the annual Twenty20 tournament.

India legend Tendulkar, the most prolific run-scorer of all time, and West Indian hero Lara will be joined by the likes of Virender Sehwag, Brett Lee and Muttiah Muralitharan.

Australia hero Brett Lee has also signed up (Picture: Getty)

The tournament will be played in February next year in Mumbai, with the proceeds going to the Road Safety Cell.

Tendulkar, widely recognised as the most complete batsman of all time, will be return to the crease for the first time since playing three exhibition T20s in America four years ago.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Lara, who had a health scare earlier in the year, still holds the record for the highest individual Test score after hitting 400 not out against England in 2004.
